Here, sudden from the shadowy band,</br>A spruce and gallant spirit started;</br>Trim were his whiskers, white his hand,</br>Adonis-form'd, and lion-hearted.
Victor of ladies and of foes,</br>The tilt-yard trembled at his lance;</br>Soft madrigals he could compose,</br>Could strike the lute and lead the dance.
In courts, or camps, where'er he mov'd,</br>Respect and fame his steps attend;</br>Honour'd by kings, by beauties lov'd,</br>Eliza's subject, Sydney's friend.
Thus, in the middle of his prosing,</br>He cuts the Lord Chief Justice short:</br>"Friend Coke, you set the audience dozing;</br>'Tis time, Sir, to adjourn the court.
"Bards can to fable truth impart,</br>Embellish'd by poetic diction;</br>You, lawyers, have the happier art,</br>To make ev'n truth appear a fiction.
"Though, gentle Bard!  no votive lay</br>Shall mark where rests thy hallow'd dust;</br>Though solemn fabrics far away</br>Receive thy consecrated bust:
"Yet know a patron shall arise,</br>Sprung from high chiefs of Albion's band;</br>From sages sprung, who humanize</br>With arts of peace a savage land.
"He, 'mid these scenes whose shades among</br>The warbling Muses caught thine ear,</br>Worthy the poet and the song,</br>A monumental shrine shall rear.
"Near, are the village fathers laid,</br>Recorded in thy plaintive shade,</br>Near, Eton's academic shade,</br>And lofty Windsor's proud domain.
"Here, when the moon's wan lustre pours</br>A trembling radiance o'er the grove,</br>Or in pale twilight's glimmering hours,</br>Thy gentle spirit oft shall rove.
"Not like the goblins grim that scare</br>The maidens as they come from milking,</br>And render useless Jefford's care,</br>Her hopes of cream and custard bilking:
"Mild as the Sylphs that gently rise,</br>That glide in airy form along;</br>And, unobserv'd by vulgar eyes,</br>Seen only by the man of song.
"The massy roofs, the embattled wall,</br>That seem the assaults of Time to scorn,</br>Shall fall — but glorious in their fall,</br>With ruin'd state the scene to adorn.
"While on yon upland's breezy height,</br>Design'd by classic Wyatt's taste,</br>A polish'd dome shall charm the sight,</br>With Graecia's purest orders grac'd:
"And in the placid wave below,</br>That seems through shadowy dells to glide,</br>With mild refulgence shall it glow,</br>Reflected in the silver tide.
"The walls excluding every view,</br>The walks by line and compass laid,</br>Clipt to unsightly shape the yew,</br>And cabinets of tonsile shade,
"Shall vanish all — for 'mid these seats</br>Lo!  a magician waves the wand;</br>And starch formality retreats</br>From Albion's cultivated land.
"Thro' fragrant shrubs, thro' plants unknown,</br>From climes yet undiscover'd brought,</br>Smooth winds the undulating zone,</br>As nature had its progress taught.
"Nor shall, my Lord Chief Justice, you</br>The change with envious eye discerning,</br>Your legal worth neglected view—</br>For, (friend of universal learning,
"Patron of worth in every form,</br>Revering happy Albion's laws,</br>With patriot ardour nobly warm,</br>Zealous in temperate Freedom's cause;)
"The princely owner's liberal hand</br>Shall to thy name a column raise,</br>And all who tread this fairy land,</br>As on its former lord they gaze,
"Shall, while of taste this lov'd abode,</br>With never-wearied step they trace,</br>Bless the true votary of that code</br>Which guards what every Muse has grac'd."</br>
